title: The Data Architect
subtitle: Lists of Dictionaries & Nested Structures
description:
# Complex Data Structures

Real applications use complex nested data. Learn to work with lists of dictionaries and multi-level structures!

## Lists of Dictionaries

Store multiple related items:

```python
party = [
    {"name": "Aria", "class": "Mage", "level": 5},
    {"name": "Thorin", "class": "Warrior", "level": 7},
    {"name": "Luna", "class": "Rogue", "level": 6}
]

# Access items
first_member = party[0]
print(first_member["name"])  # "Aria"

# Loop through
for member in party:
    print(f"{member['name']} - Level {member['level']}")
```

## Nested Dictionaries

```python
guild = {
    "name": "Dragon Slayers",
    "leader": {"name": "Aria", "level": 10},
    "members": [
        {"name": "Bob", "level": 5},
        {"name": "Eve", "level": 7}
    ]
}

print(guild["leader"]["name"])  # "Aria"
print(guild["members"][0]["name"])  # "Bob"
```

## Filtering and Searching

```python
# Find high-level members
high_level = [m for m in party if m["level"] >= 6]

# Calculate average level
total = sum(m["level"] for m in party)
average = total / len(party)
```

## Your Quest

Create a party management system:
1. Store party members as list of dicts
2. Add new members
3. Find members by class
4. Calculate party statistics

solutionCode:
# Party Management System

party = [
    {"name": "Aria", "class": "Mage", "level": 8, "health": 100},
    {"name": "Thorin", "class": "Warrior", "level": 10, "health": 150},
    {"name": "Luna", "class": "Rogue", "level": 7, "health": 90}
]

print("=== PARTY ROSTER ===")
for member in party:
    print(f"{member['name']} - {member['class']} Level {member['level']}")

print("\n=== ADDING NEW MEMBER ===")
new_member = {"name": "Shadow", "class": "Assassin", "level": 9, "health": 80}
party.append(new_member)
print(f"Added {new_member['name']} to the party!")

print("\n=== FIND ALL WARRIORS ===")
warriors = []
for member in party:
    if member["class"] == "Warrior":
        warriors.append(member)
        
print(f"Warriors in party: {len(warriors)}")
for warrior in warriors:
    print(f"  - {warrior['name']} (Level {warrior['level']})")

print("\n=== PARTY STATISTICS ===")
# Calculate average level
total_level = 0
for member in party:
    total_level += member["level"]
    
average_level = total_level / len(party)
print(f"Average party level: {average_level:.1f}")

# Calculate total health
total_health = 0
for member in party:
    total_health += member["health"]
    
print(f"Total party health: {total_health}")

print("\n=== HIGH LEVEL MEMBERS (Level 8+) ===")
for member in party:
    if member["level"] >= 8:
        print(f"  - {member['name']}: Level {member['level']}")
hints: To find warriors, check: if member['class'] == 'Warrior':
To filter high level: if member['level'] >= 8:

validationTests.description: Must use append() to add member
